books.title: The Black Moth
books.author: Georgette Heyer
books.summary: An earl turned highwayman repeatedly foils a rake in his attempted pursuit of a young woman.

books.title: King Solomon’s Mines
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: Allan Quatermain leads a group of adventurers into an unknown region of Africa in a search for fame and glory.

books.title: The Autobiography of Ma-Ka-Tai-Me-She-Kia-Kiak, or Black Hawk
books.author: Black Hawk
books.summary: The autobiography of Black Hawk, the famous leader of the Native American Sauk tribe and central figure in the Black Hawk War of 1832.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Story of Doctor Dolittle
books.author: Hugh Lofting
books.summary: A kindhearted doctor who can speak the language of animals embarks on a whimsical adventure to Africa.

books.title: Twelfth Night
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A woman disguises herself as a man and becomes entangled in the courtship of two aristocrats.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: The Way of All Flesh
books.author: Samuel Butler
books.summary: Four generations of the Pontifex family grow to adulthood in Victorian England, encountering challenges that satirize the era along the way.

books.title: The Room in the Dragon Volant
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: After an Englishman traveling in France meets a mysterious woman, he becomes embroiled in a dangerous intrigue.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.

books.title: The Circular Staircase
books.author: Mary Roberts Rinehart
books.summary: A middle-aged spinster rents a country home for the summer and finds herself in the middle of a murder mystery.

books.title: Culture and Anarchy
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: Matthew Arnold describes what he considers to be the flaws in Victorian British society.

books.title: Human Nature and Conduct
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: Dewey applies the theory of pragmatism to morality, reason, and society.

books.title: Beowulf
books.author: Anonymous
books.summary: A hero is hired to kill a monster that has been plaguing the land.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: The Time Machine
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A mysterious inventor travels to a land far off in time.

books.title: Fifty-One Tales
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A series of otherworldly short stories ranging from the moral to the whimsical.

books.title: The Pilgrim Kamanita
books.author: Karl Gjellerup
books.summary: An Indian merchant’s son sets on a pilgrimage after a life of love, loss, business, and pleasure, and unknowingly relates his tale to the Buddha.

books.title: Letters Written During a Short Residence in Sweden, Norway, and Denmark
books.author: Mary Wollstonecraft
books.summary: Mary Wollstonecraft’s account of her travels through Scandinavia.
